result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Possess Body Armor - Convicted V. Felon

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andres Salinas-Saucedo

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM/ RM 203. Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared in person, in custody in Langlade County Jail. Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court reviews case history. Def. wishes to continue with proceeding without counsel. State wishes to proceed with P.H. State requests Court find counts transactionally related. Court reviews criminal complaint and questions State regarding Ct. 1 in criminal complaint. State responds. Court finds Counts are transactionally related. State calls first witness, Deputy Travis Krueger. Deputy Krueger sworn in under oath and testifies. Def. has no questions for witness. State rests. Court questions if Def. has any witnesses, Def. declines. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. Court cannot continue with arraignment because no counsel appointed. Information needs to be filed within 30 days. Status of counsel to be held at a later date. Bond continues.
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:21 PM/RM 301.  Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history and appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court advises Def. of right to P.H. within time limits and questions if Def. would like to waive time limits and wait for counsel. Def. does not understand, Court explains. Def. requests P.H. within 10 days. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:33 PM Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court notes appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court agrees Def. should have counsel and finds good cause to go past time limits. Def. questions discovery. Court responds.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:58 AM Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD Office and is still awaiting counsel. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court agrees and finds good cause to go past time limits. State is in agreeance and is in compliance with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:07 PM Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. qualifies for PD and is still awaiting counsel. Def. continues to ask for counsel and court finds good cause to exceed time limits via Nhia Lee Standards. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:44 PM Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Court reviews history of case.  Def. is trying to get an attorney. Court finds Nhia Lee Standards and finds good cause.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:28 PM Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Def. made contact with Attorney.  State makes statement. Response by defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No contact with Justin McGarry and Luis Fernando Villegas. No possession of firearms. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff's Department.

12:14 PM in Room 203. Defendant Andres Salinas-Saucedo appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $50,000 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no contact with Justin McGarry and Luis Fernando Villegas, no possession of firearms, not leave the State of Wisconsin, surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff's Dept. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $50,000 cash bond with conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
